Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 751 Filed 08/10/22 Page 171 of 261 1332
LC6Cmax5 McHugh - cross
1 account; right?
2 A. Yes.
3 Q. But I can also authorize someone else that's not me to have signing authority over that same account; right?
4 A. Yes.
5 Q. And that person - if they're properly authorized by me, the account holder - can then sign checks on that account under their own authority because I've given that to them; isn't that right?
9 A. If authorized.
10 Q. If there is a proper authorization in place; right?
11 A. Yes.
12 Q. And that is called signatory authority in that case; right?
13 A. Yes.
14 Q. And there are other types of authorities you can give someone over accounts to besides signatory authority; correct?
15 A. Uh --
16 Q. I'll give you an example.
17 A. Please.
18 Q. Power of attorney?
19 A. Yes.
20 Q. You can give somebody power of attorney authority over an account; correct?
21 A. Yes.
22 Q. And if you give that person power of attorney authority
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
